dialogue.text: I lay down in the nice, cool bed… It felt so good that the window had been open all day.
I slid my hand under the pillow and felt a pleasant chill.
...Too bad the fairy will take the tooth, and I won’t be able to show it to Mike. He loves weird stuff, hahaha.
I placed the tooth under the pillow and lay on my back, staring at the ceiling.
My eyelids seemed to come alive and tried to close on their own, hugging each other…
*A strange sound of cracking wall echoed…*
I felt fear squeezing me, as if shrinking me smaller and smaller…
My imagination had already started creating strange shapes that frightened me, so I stared at the window, trying to find at least some calm in it.
The moonlight stopped coming into the room…
Something strange and huge was trying to squeeze through my window.
— I said in a slightly trembling voice.
Something massive and bubbling was getting closer to me… There were no footsteps, only the fluttering of wings like a hummingbird.
